meanings.definition: Support or sustain (something) by placing something underneath it.
meanings.sent1: She uppropped the wobbly table with a book.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers uppropped the beam with a sturdy pole.
meanings.sent3: The cat uppropped the toy mouse under the couch for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: His confidence was uppropped by the encouraging words of his friends.
meanings.sent5: The old tree was uppropped by its extensive root system.

meanings.definition: To prop up or hold up.
meanings.sent1: He uppropped the fence with a new post.
meanings.sent2: The gardener uppropped the drooping plant with a stake.
meanings.sent3: The comedian uppropped his failing joke with a funny gesture.
meanings.sent4: Her determination uppropped her through the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella uppropped the rain-soaked roof, providing temporary shelter.
